metadata.synopsis: In Bhaal Temple, Orin would display her kills for other Bhaalist and to honour Bhaal himself with the kills. She kills not just for fun, but she sees murder as an artform.If Orin has impersonated 2 person in Wyrm's Crossing (possible targets The Smith, The Journalist, The DyingAttacker, or The Flaming Fist), their bodies will end up in Bhaal Temple.2 Bhaalist NPCs will comment and facinate over the way she has killed the victims.In the edge-case where Orin might not have impersonated anyone in Wyrm's Crossing, a random citizen's body will be used on display instead.

4.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Eni
4.text: You are well studied in Lady Orin's ways, I see.
4.context: NodeContext: super creepily into the murders being described in this dialogue

8.speaker: Unholy Assassin Mitchia
8.text: One cannot be a true Unholy Assassin without knowing their betters.
8.context: NodeContext: super creepily into the murders being described in this dialogue

7.speaker: Unholy Assassin Mitchia
7.text: And we've never seen a murderer quite like Lady Orin before. No one has.
7.context: NodeContext: super creepily into the murders being described in this dialogue

6.speaker: Unholy Assassin Mitchia
6.text: So, tell me. If this was your kill, how would you have done it?
6.context: NodeContext: super creepily into the murders being described in this dialogue

1.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Eni
1.text: I'd have ripped the spine out, and worn its carcass as a cowl.
1.context: NodeContext: super creepily into the murders being described in this dialogue

2.speaker: Unholy Assassin Mitchia
2.text: Inventive, but wasteful. What of the backbone - you would discard it?
2.context: NodeContext: super creepily into the murders being described in this dialogue

5.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Eni
5.text: Of course not. I'd save it for later - there's always use for a spine.
5.context: NodeContext: super creepily into the murders being described in this dialogue

13.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Eni
13.text: I believe Orin first made an incision in the upper left clavicle.
13.context: NodeContext: super creepily into the murders being described in this dialogue

10.speaker: Unholy Assassin Mitchia
10.text: I am afraid I must disagree. Orin's first cut was quite clearly the throat.
10.context: NodeContext: super creepily into the murders being described in this dialogue

16.speaker: Unholy Assassin Mitchia
16.text: But... would she not toy with the victim? Why begin with a death blow?
16.context: NodeContext: super creepily into the murders being described in this dialogue

11.speaker: Unholy Assassin Mitchia
11.text: A properly cut throat does not kill right away. It bleeds the victim.
11.context: NodeContext: super creepily into the murders being described in this dialogue

3.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Eni
3.text: Like a prize piglet, trussed up for the slaughter... Yes. You're quite right.
3.context: NodeContext: almost a lustful description of murder

14.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Eni
14.text: Tell me, then. If you were Orin, how would you have killed it?
14.context: NodeContext: super creepily into the murders being described in this dialogue

15.speaker: Unholy Assassin Mitchia
15.text: I would never dare to compare myself to Lady Orin.
15.context: NodeContext: super creepily into the murders being described in this dialogue

12.speaker: Unholy Assassin Mitchia
12.text: But if it were my kill... Well. It would've been slower.
12.context: NodeContext: super creepily into the murders being described in this dialogue

9.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Eni
9.text: You'd have poisoned your prey? Seems a bit... dull.
9.context: NodeContext: super creepily into the murders being described in this dialogue

0.speaker: Unholy Assassin Mitchia
0.text: Not if the poison made the skin leak blood and the eyes weep pus. Be creative.
0.context: NodeContext: super creepily into the murders being described in this dialogue
